hero.title: Problem Solving
hero.description: Hello, I'm Jiin Seok, a frontend developer who has solved many problems thanks to the freedom created by structuring, standardization, and automation, and wants to convey this value to all users. I want to work together to provide efficiency for customer pain points, ensure that it doesn't become more difficult than familiar manual work, and create a reliable and understandable frontend.
hero.code-question: What problems have you solved with TypeScript and Next.js?
hero.code-answer: I've improved user experience and development productivity through type safety and server-side rendering.

til.title: Today I Learned
til.description: A technical blog where I organize what I've learned during frontend development.
til.a1: Next.js makes React application development more convenient by providing various features such as server-side rendering (SSR), static site generation (SSG), file-based routing, API routes, and image optimization.
til.a2: TypeScript improves code stability through a static type system and helps detect errors during development. It also enhances development productivity through IDE auto-completion features and helps with code documentation.
til.a3: React Query was created to solve the complexity of server state management. It simplifies API call-related state management by providing features such as caching, background updates, and data synchronization.
til.q4: How do Type and Interface differ?
til.a4: Type and Interface are two ways to define types in TypeScript. Interface is good for extensibility and allows declaration merging, while Type allows for more diverse type expressions such as union types and intersection types.
til.q5: When and how should you specify types for useState?
til.a5: You should explicitly specify types for useState using generics when type inference from the initial value is not sufficient. This is particularly useful for states that include null or undefined, or complex object types.

cta.title: Work With Me
cta.description: If you have any inquiries about project collaboration, recruitment, or anything else, please contact me.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Common questions about frontend development and my work.
faq.q1: What frontend technologies do you specialize in?
faq.a1: I specialize in modern frontend technologies including React, TypeScript, Next.js, and various CSS frameworks. I focus on creating responsive, accessible, and performant user interfaces.
faq.q2: How do you approach responsive design?
faq.a2: I use a mobile-first approach with CSS frameworks like Tailwind CSS. I ensure that interfaces work well on all device sizes by using responsive design principles, flexible layouts, and thorough testing.
faq.q3: Do you have experience with state management?
faq.a3: Yes, I have extensive experience with various state management solutions including React Context API, Redux, Zustand, and React Query for server state. I choose the appropriate solution based on project requirements.
faq.q4: How do you ensure code quality?
faq.a4: I maintain code quality through comprehensive testing (unit, integration, and E2E), code reviews, static type checking with TypeScript, linting, and following best practices for performance and accessibility.
faq.q5: Can you work with design systems?
faq.a5: Yes, I have experience implementing and maintaining design systems. I understand the importance of consistent UI components and can work with designers to translate their vision into reusable code components.
